data.title: Scheduler insecurely trigger callback after unschedule
data.body:
![wechatimg99](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/632460/26780280/92edd402-4a1b-11e7-9cb9-3b44a5497b2c.jpeg)

The logic in Timer::update will trigger multiple times the callback if time passed is longer than one interval, it's designed to make sure the scheduled task is invoked accurately with time passed.

The problem is that it's not checking whether the timer is still valid. User could unschedule the task in the first trigger, then trigger the callback more times is no longer safe. As you can see, I met a crash here.

So to reproduce the problem:

1. Set the fps to 10 fps for example.
2. new / malloc a variable for example (A).
3. Schedule a task which uses the variable A with a frequency of 60 times per second.
4. The task will unschedule itself directly in the callback and delete / free variable A.
5. Then during the second time your task is being scheduled, you will access to a wild pointer A.

data.title: Merge v3.15.1
fix gradle setting
Doesn’t work with SocketIO 2.0.1 and failed calling back with old version?
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.15
- devices test on: Simulator, real devices

I've tried to upgrade to SocketIO 2.0.1 but got crashed while connecting.
`client.second->socketClosed();` line 993 , SocketIO.cpp (i'm using latest cocos version)

The older SocketIO version: 1.7.3, it works. But failed to implement call back like this

`socket.emit('testcallback', 'Welcome' , callThis)`

On the cocos, `_client.on` will receive event name as `testcallbac` (without k character), i've tried to change many event name like `abc`, it always lose 1 last character. It only work without emit callback method like this:

`socket.emit('testcallback', 'Welcome')`

So anyway to implement emit callback here?

data.title: Fix particle aspect for non-sqaure tile
data.body:
Currently, if you use a non square tile (Texture from SpriteFrame) the
particle is stretched to look as a square. This fixes it so the particle
looks as in the original image. Thanks

data.title: getAttachNode delay when i move my hero (3D fps game)
Update CCNode.cpp comment typo.
RefPtr: Renable ability to use foward declares with RefPtr
data.body:
The addition of this static_assert removed the ability to use forward declared types with a RefPtr, so I've removed it.

```
class Dog;
RefPtr<Dog> m_dog; // Fails at compile time in current v3

class Man;
std::shared_ptr<Man> m_man; // Compiles, RefPtr should follow same paradigm.
```

data.title: [Request] Support for Tiled 1.0
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: v3.15

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a new project and create a new Tiled map file `.tmx` using [Tiled v1.0](http://www.mapeditor.org/2017/05/24/tiled-1-0-0-released.html) which was recently released.

2. Add one of the following to `HelloWorld::init`

```cpp
auto map = experimental::TMXTiledMap::create("test.tmx");
```
OR
```cpp
auto map = TMXTiledMap::create("test.tmx");
```

3. Run the project and it will crash giving you the following error:
```
cocos2d: TMXFormat: Unsupported TMX version: 1.0.0
```

Even after removing the [code block that parses the version](https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/blob/v3/cocos/2d/CCTMXXMLParser.cpp#L235-L238) to force load the map, the game will crash with a segmentation fault in Linux. Here's the relevant excerpt from `valgrind`:

```
==8709== Process terminating with default action of signal 11 (SIGSEGV): dumping core
==8709==  Access not within mapped region at address 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF8
==8709==    at 0xA27052: cocos2d::Vector<cocos2d::TMXTilesetInfo*>::back() const (CCVector.h:283)
==8709==    by 0xA22CA4: cocos2d::TMXMapInfo::startElement(void*, char const*, char const**) (CCTMXXMLParser.cpp:423)
==8709==    by 0xA2CF7D: cocos2d::SAXParser::startElement(void*, unsigned char const*, unsigned char const**) (CCSAXParser.cpp:179)
==8709==    by 0xA2CB99: cocos2d::XmlSaxHander::VisitEnter(tinyxml2::XMLElement const&, tinyxml2::XMLAttribute const*) (CCSAXParser.cpp:72)
==8709==    by 0xC8858E: tinyxml2::XMLElement::Accept(tinyxml2::XMLVisitor*) const (tinyxml2.cpp:1479)
==8709==    by 0xC885C7: tinyxml2::XMLElement::Accept(tinyxml2::XMLVisitor*) const (tinyxml2.cpp:1481)
==8709==    by 0xC885C7: tinyxml2::XMLElement::Accept(tinyxml2::XMLVisitor*) const (tinyxml2.cpp:1481)
==8709==    by 0xC85F04: tinyxml2::XMLDocument::Accept(tinyxml2::XMLVisitor*) const (tinyxml2.cpp:574)
==8709==    by 0xA2CD34: cocos2d::SAXParser::parse(char const*, unsigned long) (CCSAXParser.cpp:143)
==8709==    by 0xA2CE07: cocos2d::SAXParser::parse(std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> > const&) (CCSAXParser.cpp:152)
```

Tiled also uses a new XML file ending in `.tsx` for loading tilesets.

data.title: [Playback] ❗️Failed to queue any items.  iOS-videoPlayer
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version:0x00030500
- devices test on: IOS
- developing environments
   - NDK version:
   - Xcode version:
   - VS version:
   - browser type and version:

Error:
[Playback] ❗️Failed to queue any items.
1. create a "VideoPlayer" ,ccexp.VideoPlayer:create()
2. setFileName and play it , addEventListener
3. then  add a listener  ,as follows:
self.videoPlayer:addEventListener(function(videoPlayer, eventType) 
        if eventType == ccexp.VideoPlayerEvent.PLAYING then
            print("PLAYING")
        elseif eventType == ccexp.VideoPlayerEvent.PAUSED then
            print("PAUSED")
        elseif eventType == ccexp.VideoPlayerEvent.STOPPED then
            print("STOPPED")
        elseif eventType == ccexp.VideoPlayerEvent.COMPLETED then
        --播放完成时处理回调
            print("COMPLETED")
            self.videoPlayer:stop()
        end
    end)
4. You will see  errors in terminal in Xcode :
 [Playback] ❗️Failed to queue any items.
5.if you dont call stop or  remove this scene, this error will not appeared.  BTW:it will not crashed ,but error so bright, I want to know how to fix it  or use videoplayer correctly to stop it and remove it.

THX for reading it.

data.title: [android] Avoid FPS greater than 60 if vsync is closed
Action sometimes be revocation.
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: cur v3 branch
- devices test on:
- developing environments
   - NDK version:
   - Xcode version:
   - VS version:
   - browser type and version:

Steps to Reproduce:

1. run those code in hello world.
```
local time = 2
local seq = transition.sequence({
    cc.DelayTime:create(time),
    cc.CallFunc:create(function()
        print("aaa")
    end),
})
transition.execute(self, seq)
```
2. . I didn't do anything to stop this action. But sometimes it happen this action do not print ```aaa```, it is rarely happen, but do happen in ```v3.15```, I upgrade before ```v3.13```, but not ever happen in  ```v3.13```, please have a look, thanks

[Chinese forum issue](http://forum.cocos.com/t/v3-15/47014)

may be reference to this patch. [Flag the end of ActionInstant and ActionInterval. ](https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/pull/17557)

could you have a look ? @j-jorge

data.title: setPosition() breaks widgets+scrollView
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.15
- devices test on: windows, android
- developing environments
   - NDK version: 12b
   - VS version: Community 2015 Update 2

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Create new C++ project
2.  Replace HelloWorldScene.cpp with the uploaded one.
3. Compile and execute
4. Scrolling works fine
5.1. Clicking on the right side of a color button doesn't call touch/lambda function (which outputs log info)
5.2 Clicking on the left side of a color button calls lambda function and outputs log info

Reason of this bad behaviour:

Calling setPositionX() to widget's descendant node to center inside ScrollView. setPositionX() effectively moves the node but touch handler doesn't notice it so touching reacts as if the node hadn't been moved.

**NOTE** Calling setPositionX() to widget's itself does nothing, thus forcing me to call setPositionX() to node's descendant.

Seems like this kind of problem has been around for a while. See this [post](http://discuss.cocos2d-x.org/t/how-to-add-buttons-to-a-scrollview-without-interfering-with-scrolling/31467/7). My code is based on it in an attempt to make it work for my real game. This helped finding out polishing how to reproduce the error but need badly to create a nice scroll menu, 

[HelloWorldScene.zip](https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/files/1039109/HelloWorldScene.zip)
